title: Concept behind 1 v 1ing when behind. Also some advice.
body:
So you fed your laner 3 kills and you're 1/3 and he's 3/1. What thought process are you going through to think you can win ? I am jungler and I say please wait for a gank and you decide to engage whilst I am botlane then complain that I didn't gank or say " You said you would gank wtf?". 

So firstly is it not possible for you to wait under tower and farm as best as you can? 
Do I not have other lanes I need to gank? 
Why must you fight, why can't you farm?
If you're countered then play safe?

I had a game where my top laner who was playing {{champion:92}}  I ganked her once then she got a kill after I left and we had burnt his flash. She went 1/6 because he tried over and over to 1 v 1 a Jayce, lost the 1 kill lead and gave Jayce 6 kills. I mean c'mon... That is ridiculous nonsense for someone who was in Gold 1 to be doing. Gold and Plat isn't actually a very good rank but at least use common sense? Anyhow we lost cause Riven went 0/9 and a Platinum Thresh/Caitlyn didn't know how to poke,farm or kite and fed Vayne 12 kills. At 20 Minutes Riven was 1/7, my mid laner {{champion:90}} didn't know how to ward so was always pushed and always got ganked. It was a hopeless game and yes I got fed up because Riven repeatedly actually went to 1 v 1 jayce when she was 1/7 and he was now 9/2. I ended up giving up at 25 minutes when we had all inhibs taken and ended up raging to the enemy team. They called me bad, and the reason I lost  and that I fed everyone. Which was actually good for me despite them not understanding since they were given a free match of LP. Yes I was angry and especially since I was in my promos but the worst thing to do is to rage to the enemy team. Just don't say anything. Just say nothing at all, they only will make you angrier and blame you for the loss which in turn makes you rant about how bad your team was and distracts you from the game.

Also if you are the enemy team please understand when someone ranting about trolling/playing terribly/feeding team mates and try and sympathise. Don't rub it in or trash talk it's literally like saying ez in a 4 v 5. Don't do it because you hate it when it's done to you or when your team mates feed there eyeballs out. If they are over the top tell them to chill or relax but don't say " no wonder you all lost, you're so  toxic and such a bad player," when you say this it doesn't help and only makes it worse. I'm not justifying ranting or raging I am just saying try and be understanding and deal with the person as if they were on your team. If a Jinx goes 1/18 at 30 minutes and her jungler is raging about her being a complete waste of time then understand that you would also feel the same way if she was on your team.

I am normally very tolerant and positive but it is hard when you get 3 bad teams in a row for your promos. 
So just take it easy and ignore everyone or turn off /all which most people don't do because they often actually want to talk to the enemy team.

I expect in 90% of my games to score 20% of my kills due to turret hits. It sounds bad, but when playing top lane, I always skirmish until about 1/3 health and then bait next to my turret. A bad player would simply see that predicament as a dead end with no hope. However, you need to remember what you're up against. 

If you are against Melee with ranged engage and they have plenty of health to kill you, let them jump you and flash to the opposite side of your turret, simply run a circle around it while they take hits because they assumed the initial dive would get you. You should never blow flash unless it's for a deathless kill or late game team fight. Using it early game to escape simply means that you failed at playing lane, now play smart, what you should have done before hand.

If you are facing ranged consistent poke, just back, lose the CS and lose the turret. They are going to get it ANYWAY, your death will just add upon that.

Many times players think that by standing next to their turret throwing off abilities, it will dissuade the enemy from diving and taking the turret as well. That almost never works. Losing a turret is not the worst case scenario. Losing a turret, dying and letting the enemy keep pushing is.
